website_summaries.verdict: Though performance could be better and it could stand for some hardware upgrades, the RIM BlackBerry Torch 9800 and BlackBerry OS 6 offer much-needed improvements to stay in step with the competition, and keep BlackBerry enthusiasts happy.
pros: The RIM BlackBerry Torch combines both a touch screen and full QWERTY keyboard
BlackBerry OS 6 brings such improvements as a better user interface, universal search, and an improved browser and multimedia experience
cons: The Torch has a lower-resolution screen
Applications can  be saved only to the phone's main memory

customer_reviews.title: A messed up phone i wasted money on.. Its garbage!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because I thought it would work well to take notes and to write down my assignments that were doing except for you know I could to inform me that these keys on the keyboard art correct as in the q key is the Z key, and the a key is the S key....... that's ridiculous... Had you told me this I would have purchased this item regardless and I would have kept it but you somehow neglected to inform me that they phone isn't working correctly
customer_reviews.author: tishara

customer_reviews.title: cool phone
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, this phone works great, capacitive screen is very responsive and you have a full qwerty keyboard if your not into the whole type on screen thing. Only issue with this phone is when speaking with on it on your ear, your ear somehow manages to press either the hold button or the mute button, hence the 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Mo
